commands/ls.c

00001 /*******************************************************************************
00002  **
00003  ** Module Name: ls.c
00004  **
00005  ** Project Name: Minishell-UVT
00006  **
00007  ********************************************************************************
00008  **
00009  ** Created By: Moraru Ionut (morion4000)
00010  **
00011  ** Description: Implementation of the UNIX ls command;
00012  **
00013  ********************************************************************************/
00014 
00015 // Main function;
00016 int com_ls(int argc, char **argv) {
00017         // Definition of local variables;
00018         DIR *dir;
00019         struct dirent *dp;
00020         struct stat     statbuf;
00021         struct passwd  *pwd;
00022         struct group   *grp;
00023         struct tm      *tm;
00024         char            datestring[256];
00025 
00026         char * dir_path = ".";
00027 
00028         int l_flag = 0, s_flag = 0, a_flag = 0, F_flag = 0;
00029         int o;
00030 
00031         // Reseting getopt internal index;
00032         optind = 0;
00033 
00034         while ((o = getopt(argc, argv, "lsaF")) != -1) {
00035          switch(o) {
00036                 case 'l':
00037                         l_flag = 1;
00038                 break;
00039                 case 's':
00040                         s_flag = 1;
00041                 break;
00042                 case 'a':
00043                         a_flag = 1;
00044                 break;
00045                 case 'F':
00046                         F_flag = 1;
00047                 break;
00048                 case '?':
00049                 default:
00050                         abort();
00051                 }
00052         }
00053 
00054         dir_path = argv[argc-1];
00055 
00056         if(a_flag || s_flag || l_flag || F_flag) {
00057                 if(!is_dir(dir_path)) {
00058                         dir_path = ".";
00059                 }
00060         } else {
00061                 if(strcmp(argv[argc-1], "ls") == 0)
00062                         dir_path = ".";
00063         }
00064 
00065         if ((dir = opendir (dir_path)) == NULL) {
00066                 fprintf (stderr, "%s is not a directory.\n", dir_path);
00067                 return -1;
00068         }
00069 
00070         while ((dp = readdir (dir)) != NULL) {
00071                 if(!a_flag) {
00072                         char c = dp->d_name[0];
00073                         if(c == '.') continue;
00074                 }
00075 
00076                 if(stat(dp->d_name, &statbuf) == -1)
00077                         ;//continue;
00078 
00079                 if(l_flag) {
00080                         if(!a_flag && (strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") == 0 || strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") == 0)) {
00081                                 continue;
00082                         }
00083 
00084                         /* Print out type, permissions, and number of links. */
00085                         printf( (S_ISDIR(statbuf.st_mode)) ? "d" : "-");
00086                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IRUSR) ? "r" : "-");
00087                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IWUSR) ? "w" : "-");
00088                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IXUSR) ? "x" : "-");
00089                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IRGRP) ? "r" : "-");
00090                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IWGRP) ? "w" : "-");
00091                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IXGRP) ? "x" : "-");
00092                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IROTH) ? "r" : "-");
00093                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IWOTH) ? "w" : "-");
00094                         printf( (statbuf.st_mode & S_IXOTH) ? "x" : "-");
00095 
00096                         printf("%4d", statbuf.st_nlink);
00097 
00098                         /* Print out owner's name if it is found using getpwuid(). */
00099                         if ((pwd = getpwuid(statbuf.st_uid)) != NULL)
00100                                 printf(" %-8.8s", pwd->pw_name);
00101                         //else
00102                         //printf(" %-8d", statbuf.st_uid);
00103 
00104                         /* Print out group name if it is found using getgrgid(). */
00105                         if ((grp = getgrgid(statbuf.st_gid)) != NULL)
00106                                 printf(" %-8.8s", grp->gr_name);
00107                         //else
00108                         //printf(" %-8d", statbuf.st_gid);
00109 
00110                         /* Print size of file. */
00111                         printf(" %9jd", (intmax_t)statbuf.st_size);
00112 
00113                         tm = localtime(&statbuf.st_mtime);
00114 
00115                         /* Get localized date string. */
00116                         strftime(datestring, sizeof(datestring), nl_langinfo(D_T_FMT), tm);
00117                         printf(" %s %s\n", datestring, dp->d_name);
00118 
00119                 } else if(s_flag) {
00120                         if(!a_flag && (strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") == 0 || strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") == 0)) {
00121                                 continue;
00122                         }
00123 
00124                         printf("%ld", statbuf.st_blocks/2);
00125                         printf(" %s\t", dp->d_name);
00126                 } else if(F_flag) {
00127                         if(!a_flag && (strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") == 0 || strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") == 0)) {
00128                                 continue;
00129                         }
00130 
00131                         printf("%s", dp->d_name);
00132                         if(S_ISDIR(statbuf.st_mode))  {
00133                                 printf("/\t");
00134                         } else if(S_ISLNK(statbuf.st_mode)) {
00135                                 printf("@\t");
00136                         } else if(statbuf.st_mode & S_IXUSR) {
00137                                 printf("*\t");
00138                         } else {
00139                                 printf("\t");
00140                         }
00141                 } else {
00142                         if(!a_flag && (strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") == 0 || strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") == 0)) {
00143                                 continue;
00144                         }
00145 
00146                         printf("%s\t", dp->d_name);
00147                 }
00148 
00149         }
00150 
00151         printf("\n");
00152 
00153         closedir(dir);
00154 
00155         return 0;
00156 }
